content: It's a good game BUT the spawn rate for monster's is way to high. Dont buy if you cant HANDEL not being able to take 2 steps without fighting a monster.

This is obviously an old school RPG so don't expect too much from it. It's good fun/time waster if you can tolerate the random monster fight and read online guides incase you get lost. Overall if you're a fan of dragon quest and like turn-based RPG this is for you. Good luck!
The story is lit but the gameplay is nothing like the first game or the later games. And the monster spawn rate is way too high.
Seems promising but.....not a big fan of the horizontal (portrait mode) fighting style or the virtual joy pad on a touch-screen device!
A pretty good game for its time. Only complaint that I had was the enemy encounter rate was pretty high which made playing through a bit annoying but hey it is what it is.
A blast from 1987. If your going to play this, know, they left it mostly an intact version of the original. Don't expect it to be "modern" as it's not.
A good game.
I had a great time!
Good game, great for killing time on an airplane
Game was great until a specific point about 65% of the way complete the game crashed. And of course you can't just reinstall because no cloud saves.
Added on to what made the 1st one great and added sea travel but sadly.... The weakest in the Erdrick trilogy.
Awesome
Thought it was a solid adventure but i got stuck on it and i had to use youtibe to get unstuck. Maybe more help wpuld be nice.

Too many encounters, no tutorial, map useless, imprecise directions. Where the devil is Moonbrooke and/or the princess? This is pure junk. Typical square enix....could be great with a little more refinement. Ah, why do I waste my time. Devs obviously don't care about us gamers or their product(s).
Love it

Don't listen to the haters & the newcomers, this game is still excellent. The game was made during a time where you needed to figure things out on your own rather than other JRPGs where they hold your hand and make things too easy to a point where it's simply boring. This Dragon Quest is one of the most challenging, but with that challenge, you feel satisfied after you win a difficult fight. The entire game is rather satisfying because of that. I urge people to pick it up, it's still fantastic.

As someone fairly new to the series, and this being my 3rd DQ game (played Heros and DQ1 prior), I definitely didn't hate dragon quest 2 but I also didn't love it either. As over leveled as I got, it still felt like such a drag to get to the end of the game on numerous occasions. The turn based system here is rather simple really. However, the length of the story, the cryptic messages (which aren't too bad but still annoying), and long winding dungeons are the real killers of DQ2 for me
Classic buy it.
I wish there was the option to look at the screen horizontally. Other than that this is a really good game.
Please fix to work on note 4 os 4.4.4. Its not compatible
Loved it, great. It's no DQ3, but great game none the less.
Good

Backgrounds stutter in motion, no cloud saves. The game is mostly boring, it's a grind but really easy for most of the game, and then there is a massive difficulty spike at the end since that section wasn't playtested. Beatable but expect to abuse the quicksave feature while grinding out levels when first arriving at the final areas. Princess is largely useless until she learns Kaboom, and even then it misses sometimes, so she's mostly useless.
Amazing game üòÅ
Yeah the game sucks lmao, but thats what II was like on the NES too, so good port
Random encounter rate is ridiculous, decent Nesrpg, alittle cheesy, I planned to try more but really expensive for what it is

Did they cry about grinding in these games..Well...come at me after you level every class in WOW and then Clear endgame raids with 3 or 4 of them...kids are just weaks these days. Going through the series for the first time. Dragon Warrior started RPG's for me. I got my Dragon Warrior copy from the NINTENDO POWER subscription..for FREE. For that...I am a true OG. Oh...and I am skipping playing DQ1, too simple to play though again.
Complete p2w garbage
I'm about 2 hours in, and this game is a total improvement over the first one. In terms of the port I would say this is the definitive way to play DQ2. The controls are surprisingly perfect.
So far a great game. Plays just fine and I am enjoying it like the original. I have missed playing it.

This was a really fun game to pick up and play. It is pretty dated, but the graphics seem to have been updated since it first came out. I saw some complaints about the frequency of encounters, and I agree with them. The encounter rate is very high, but the game is still very fun. My favorite part is probably the enemy design. While pixelated, the designs come through and look great.
Sunken Treasure It is north(west) of Rippleport. Unfortunately, the location in the ocean is suppose to sparkle but for this android port there is no sparkling. üò´
Really good but sometimes really hard.
Good game well worth the price
Lots of improvements over the original
Could use more weapons and armors for other characters. No additional content on remake. Overall still a classic DQ game worth playing

Great little game. Only reason I give it 4 instead of 5 is that the random battles come way too often. Like you can walk 3 steps and have 3 battles. Makes it so you don't have to "grind" to get to the right level but it interupts too often. Other than that it's a fun, simple game.

The second best version of Dragon Quest 2 this version which is the same as the switch except with worse controls is the most fair version of Dragon Quest 2 that is available with difficulty balancing that makes your 2nd party member not dead weight along with your level up stats meaning alot more makes this a fun fairly quick and enjoyable game even on Mobile phones

This sequel to the original RPG masterpiece is a masterpiece in and of itself. Dragon Quest II is a fantastic game that improves upon every aspect of its predecessor. It may be difficult, but the grinding comes naturally as you explore the world and you'll be well prepared to face the gradually harder enemies.
Playing this now. The encounter rate is exactly like the nes was. Usually takes me 8 to 10 hours to find treasures. Less than 45 minutes. So far 4 stars. But not quite half way thru it.
Another great DQ game!

I wanted to play all of the Dragon Quest games in sequence and have purchased all that are available in the app store. I had to abandon this one part of the way through though. I'm no stranger to the grinding aspect of random battles in RPG's but the encounter rate in this game is throttled a bit too high for me to really enjoy this one. That's the reason I had to deduct a star. If you guys ever decide to reduce the encounter rate a bit I will definitely come back and give this one another shot.
I am Final Fantasy fan and Dragon Quest is no difference. Love the game. üëç
It's good for it's time.
It's ok. Lay off the enemy encounters every two or three steps. It's a long game with a big story line, don't worry we'll get our money's worth.
Enjoyed playing this one, great for the mobile.
Crappy
Confusing with the changes they made from the original DQ2. Why'd they feel the need to change so much stuff?

DQ2 is always an amazing game, but the graphical and musical updates were absolutely unnecessary and have actually hurt the experience. It's a shame updating the graphics for today's younger ADD generation is needed to make sales, as the original DQ2 is far superior to this version.

I mostly missed out on this game during the NES era, so I'm happy to finally have a chance to play it now. I just beat the game and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I was a bit skeptical about the controls at first, but I got used to them fairly quickly and found that they work really well in a game like this, where you're either exploring a 2D environment or doing turn-based combat. I highly recommend this game for old school RPG fans.
A deeper experience than the first DQ, but also a bit of a mess. You'll probably need a guide for this one. A good guide.
What a game. Jesus. I didn't meet any issues people mentioned. Played on a huawei P10 lite on October 2019. I loved every second of this game.
Amazing!
Just finished 2, so onto number 3 but still this game was a fantastic experience. By far one of the best RPGs I've ever played hands down

They changed the names of all the spells and enemies. Healmore is midheal, why? Babbles are bubble slimes, huh? It's annoying. Sizz, woosh, cloak of wind is windbreaker, what is all this nonsense. At the least, it's a HUGE break in consistency with this franchise.
Awsome game can be a bit grindy at times only complaint.

A great version of DQ2 made for the mobile devices. Easily play with one hand, experience a DQ2 that is a bit more forgiving than the NES original, more like the GB port. Nice boost to graphics over the NES and GB. Just a fun game to play anywhere.
Good port.

Worked great while I was online. When I went off it gave me a "Can not connect" error and refused to play. Square Enix really is the most objoxious company, aside from Ubisoft, when it comes to DRM on every platform they sell games through. Of course, DRM issues being what they are, it will almost never be a problem while you can still refund. Saved me a good chunk of cash on 3-6, which I was planning to purchase as well, with this broken mess.
The game works quite well at this point, and while it is not the best DQ game ever, it is still damned good.
There is NO issues with Conrad learning spells. He now learns Midheal at level 18. Do your research. The game is fine.

I was hesitant to buy this game because everyone was saying that there's a game-breaking glitch where the Prince of Cannock stops learning spells at level 18. I went for it anyway, and he learned Midheal at 18 and Safe Passage at 21. Im on a Pixel 3 phone. Very happy with this game so far, it's not as bad as everyone says at all.
An underrated entry in the series with a great sense of exploration and adventure.
Gotta play them all

Beware the comments saying the Prince of Cannock stops learning spells at level 14! This is simply a change between versions. In the original version HealMore (Midheal) was learned at level 14, but he simply learns it at 18 instead!

I have no complaints about this game. Regarding the supposed 'glitch' involving the Prince of Cannock's inability to learn new skills after level 14-- this is not a glitch. In order to compensate for the increased level cap, the level at which each character learns new skills has been adjusted. This was a great continuation to the first game and I am looking forward to playing the third. Thank you for this port.

Great game, but there seems to be a mistranslation that will have you stumped if you're trying to follow what NPCs are telling you. Read below if you seem stuck with 1 sigil left SPOILERS Dragonlord's grandson tells you to get the 5 sigils and then go to the island directly due south. He's supposed to say to get the 5 sigils, and START at that island to the south. The first sigil is there. Hopefully you aren't like me wasting hours searching everywhere EXCEPT that island for the last sigil.

Contrary to some bad reviews, this game was seemingly never bugged, they've just changed the experience growth so that the Prince of Cannock has a large gap after level 14 where he doesn't learn any spells. Although considered one of the worst in the series, this port polishes it into a surprisingly nice experience. Although well known as a grindfest, it offers enough options to flow very well in the mobile environment. Absolutely the definitive version and a prerequisite to Dragon Quest 3.

NPCs tell you where to go so you are mostly never lost. world map is HUGE compared to first game. encounter rate is a little high. game is a tad grindy, but so many encounters across a huge map means grinding occurs during travel. new party system + mob fights means more strategy, and slightly longer fights than DQ1. one handed controls are a godsend just like last game. I like DQ1 more, but this was fun.

Great game but there is a bug that completely ruined my run. When I got the water sigil it didn't appear in my character status page so I wasn't able to collect all 5 and was left unable to finish the game.
My fav.

Samsung Galaxy S9 as of today. The Prince Bug is fixed. I have learned spells passed Level 14. Game itself brings back memories. Tip: Save your game before sleeping in an inn you are unfamiliar with. There is this one inn that the prince gets sick and is on his death bed. I'm sure there's a way to solve it but if you're a low level like I was it's very difficult to fix him. I just started over. Damn you prince. you always messing it up. If you find the town....avoid sleeping there.
Prince is able to learn spells after level 14, just different levels than guides say. Changed review score as I thought it was bugged before.

A classic RPG that feels like a classic RPG in all the wrong ways. It has about 20 min. of content stretched out by dozens of fetch quests, a sky-high encounter rate, and dungeon design that would make Final Fantasy II blush. A warning--you NEED to grind and collect certain special equipment if you want to beat the final boss. Play if you love Dragon Quest and have a lot of patience. Play if you have played any other DQ and are morbidly curious. Otherwise, just stay away.

Was excited to try my hand at going through the DQ series since I had failed to do so as a kid. Was really annoyed to see that the Prince of Cannock spell level bug still persists for Android Pixel devices and possibly others. Please fix this! I even lost my save file just to try and "reinstall" to the same issue!
thoroughly enjoyed

Although a lot easier than the old NES game, this game has much to offer. It's interface is easy to pick up, and the story is great. The updated version, has more dialogue than the original. With very little difference as far as maps and item placement. The updated graphics are subpar; but it's a Dragon Quest game...(if you want graphics go to Final Fantasy). Overall, a great value for an awesome game.
My Prince of Cannock has learned magic beyond level 14. They must have patched it.
I forgot how excellent II was. You have to play this one!

I played this game solidly for a while, collecting all 4 crests up until the cave of rhone. The flame in the way says I need more crests, but i already have the false idol and all the crests except the life crests, which I'm told is inside the cave to rhone which I can't reach. I really love the game, but this issue makes it so I'm unable to finish it, if anyone has any help please tell me!

if i cannot skip slow story plotlines, it gets annoying. need a way to skip anything the player doesnt want to read. text and story is a little slow paced and dated. but the non ability to skip is. causing me to throw away my money i spent paying for this game.
Amazing game
A good game.

Dragon Quest II is actually my least favorite game in the series but unlike the IOS and Android version of Dragon Quest III its actually the best version of the game you can get, it actually fixes problems with the original game which made the game much more enjoyable. I was surprised how well it works as a phone game, its obviously pretty out dated for todays standards but its nice to play a classic RPG that was very impressive for the time.
Totally worth the price. Quick save is a nice feature too. Don't pass this one up.

A much bigger game compared to the first one, longer playtime, more characters and enemies as well as equipment. Bigger and slightly more robust story (although that really isn't saying much.) Though oddly enough it feels like it hasn't aged as well as its predecessor. Great game, took me about 16.5 hours to complete. Recommended mostly for hard fans of the franchise as it feels like the most skippable of the bunch.

The game is bugged. The Prince of Cannock stops learning spells at level 14. This bug has been ongoing since February based on the other comments. I submitted a ticket to Square Enix, ticket number 10399580. I will post if/when the ticket is resolved. For now, do not buy and Android should remove from the store. Update 5/15: Square Enix and I have had a number of back and forth emails. The guy who was helping me realized there was a bug and sent it to the next level of support. Unfortunately those guys just sent me a standard form email that basically said uninstall and reinstall with no mention of the actual issue. It appears they will not address this issue after all, nor will they provide a refund. I highly recommend that no one buy this game due to the defect.
Incompatible with galaxy s6
Pretty good game. No technical issues that I can remember.
If you have played other Dragon Quest games you'll love this one too.
It's the worst entry in the Dragon Quest series but it's still worth playing,
back to working! great game

as a port its fantastic and there were no problems. new art looks good and everything works well. as a game i just feel dragon quest 1 and 3 arr so much more enjoyable. this game was still good enough to go through but a few steps were a grind and the last cave is brutal.

Game is way too buggy. Got a decent chunk into the game until I realized the prince of cannock stopped learning new spells after lvl 14. Kept going till he was 20 and still no new spells. Game breaking bugs.
I love the Dragon Quest series. Its fun and easy to play.

finished the android version of DQ1 recently now im onto this one. I feel like it rlly fixes some of the things in the first like magic keys and divding roles by magic, combat, or combined because in the first, you had all for just 1 character and i found I barely used magic for anything other than healing. it's cute :^)

BEAUTIFUL, but I sometimes miss the NES version, music, mechanics, and all. PLEASE SELL DQ (DW) 1 & 2 EXACTLY as they were on the NES, but with touch interface & a myriad of controller options for droid phone & tablet users who have one controller or another. I can get it elsewhere, but I'd rather get it from Square Enix, out of respect and appreciation for them and all that they do and create.
i mad at it it eraste my file dont play this game
Edit: The control alignment issue is finally fixed. Now ill be able to give this a fair try!
Worse than the NES version in every way DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. also the ui is very bad also the remastered music sounds worse
Perfect
cool game

Runs extremely slow on Android 7.1. Read a review about an older version of DQ2 running slowly on someone's new phone. Game worked fine on my older phone too. Come on SquareEnix! Don't step backwards on these classics.

Great app and great game all around. This is such a jump from the first game in terms of design and was really fun to play through. I love how old school this feels and at the same time feels fairly modern.
The game seems playable again after the latest update. It took them time to fix it, but they did it. Thank you. 5 stars again.
Very good version of DQ2. Controls need some getting used to. Fun game.
Classic
A great RPG experience that rewards persistence, yet is still simple enough to enjoy in short spurts.
Great port of Dragon Quest 2 with better graphics and slightly retooled to be easier than the original NES version.

For some reason the touch screen does not work properly. When selecting "venture forth" I have to click directly above the grey box... same with entering a name, if I click the letter "A" it registers "G" and to select "A", I have to click directly above it. Same thing with all the buttons in-game. Its off centered somehow, Not sure if it's a bug or my phone. I'm using a Google Pixel 2 XL running on Android 8.1.0... I will edit my review once I figure out what the problem is.
Update 11/9 Fixes Pixel 2 XL issues. Thank you!!

The touch screen controls are misaligned. You have to remember to tap above where they actually display. This scaling problem has been happening for almost a year for this game and dragon quest 3. Stop selling a game that doesn't run on modern hardware or consider discontinuing sales. It's messed up to knowingly sell something that is broken.
Worst entry in the whole series. Skip it, and don't look back.

Worked fine on a phone i had about 4/5 years ago, but it runs so slowly on my current one which is an upgrade from there, which is really strange considering dragon quest 1 ran fine, and both this app and the dq1 app are taken from the snes comination cart with the two of them, so it should run just the same? Great game anyway though
Great game, worth every penny spent on it and every second spent playing it. A recent bug patch fixed the registration of taps for menus and actions, which is wonderful.
The game will not load after the Oct update. Nice work. First gen Pixel.
I had fun.

Edit: the touch screen issued are now fixed, game works great. Thanks. This game has the same touch screen issue that DQ1 has, where you have to tap above everything and it registers below it. However, with DQ1, you can put it in compatibility mode under app scaling and it fixes the problem. For some reason, this game doesn't show up in my list for app scaling, so I can't fix it.
October 25 update fixed button align issue at the very least. Awesome.

Finally get the chance to beat this game. Got to the last area on the NES version but had to grind to much to lvl, then DW3 came out and seeing that's my favorite game ever never really got back to this one. Can't wait till 3 comes out.

userName: Sergio Esteban De La Pe√±a Lara
content: Ke

This game plays great on the Galaxy S9+, but only in 16:9 mode. If you try to put the game into fullscreen mode, the controls will misalign. Please release the update to this and DQ3 to take advantage of the 18:9 screen, like you did DQ1.
Great port, easier than I remember but then again it's been ~30 years since I played the NES version. Turned-based RPGs are a great fit for phones. The quick-save is much appreciated.

Would buy again for PS4 it SE released in the US. Unable to farm lightning staves in Midenhall Castle like you used to, but otherwise decent port. Landscape orientation would be appreciated, but it's playable as is.
Buttons dont frikkin work waste of money and for some reason it wont let me refund

So, I really liked DQ1 whereas the game was pretty spot on other than the names of things ie, monsters, towns/dungeons/map, people I really enjoyed it and appreciate SE for putting it on mobile. Now with this game I was really enjoying it except with a few things. 1. The rate of monster encounters (seemed a little over done compared to DQ1). 2. Trying to figure out what Im supposed to do in the game DQ2 walkthroughs online arent very helpful considering a majority of them are based on SNES DW2 and so getting stuck in a few areas are easy ex, The tower of wind. 3. Which I felt being with all that was online stating POC should learn the spells at certain levels that I was getting frustrated when I wasnt learning them at the certain levels but after looking on youtube and seeing the walkthrough Piggasus had done I saw that the spells were learnt at a later level. I hope that this is it.
Gay
Game won't load crashes after install dog poop

Touchscreen is misaligned with displayed buttons on LG G7 ThinQ and android 8.0, support was not responsive. 9/12/18 Support team has been painfully slow with responding to me, game still unplayable. 9/16/18 Support team only sends scripted responses. No way to get in touch with anyone.
I'm having trouble playing this game on my device. The touch is being capture as I have pressed a little lower than where I have pressed. It's very annoying. Please fix this.
Unplayable on Q stylo plus
Love this game.

I played for about an hour. The d pad is buggy, and your mob spawn is way too high. It averages about every 1 to 5 steps. Talk about grinding. Trying to cross the map is extremely tedious...and I'm in the first area! Uninstalled. Requesting refund. Roughly 2 months now. No response. No refund. Still.
Great game, for all those getting "stuck" in the house with the whirlpool from Beran to Rhone, you can walk out of the house by going straight down from the whirlpool once you arrive in the basement.

Played great, just needs cloudsave so I can migrate the game to my new 
phone.
Needs cloud storage want to be able to transfur saves from my cell

This was a near perfect port of one of my favorite childhood games. 
However, the reimagine of the dungeons and the spells really upset me. 
There are some bugs so save frequently otherwise you will have to begin at 
the beginning.
Fix your damn game, square. Tap bug just like so many others.
Didn't work offline
Canot play. Always connecting... all the time

The app is well made and good. This is not the best Dragon Quest game 
though. Be prepared for a long, tough, multi tiered scavenger hunt of an 
rpg.
Must buy for any rpg fans!

For those with a glitch where you have to tap above what you mean too... 
turn off full screen mode for this gane in your android settings... 
settings -display-full screen apps - turn it off... great game look forward 
to continuing to replay it!

One of my favorite Dragon Warrior games as a kid. This is a superb port! 
There are a few differences from the original NES version; mainly that a 
few of the items throughout the game have been buffed, so it definitely 
feels a little easier. But this game masterfully captures that original 
jRPG NES feel.

I have headache playing this game. It always stopped. The first time it 
did, the refund button is not there. I tried and tried again and again. I 
even reset my gafget in the hope that this game work but to no avail.

First time trying out the Dragon series since I was a kid which it was then labelled Dragon Warrior. Got 75% of the way through number one then sold that device. Wished there was a way to cloud save. So I start this one. Awesome game. Zero problems. Played on S9+ Will continue to buy the series as I complete each game

This game is really fun and adds a lot of nice features over the first dragon quest, such as the ability to save in more locations.  The enemy encounter rate seemed a bit too high for my liking, but the ability to warp to different towns makes any backtracking go quickly.  For the longest time I thought I had a glitch where I could not get to Rhone/Rendarak because after taking the teleportal I would follow some stairs up to a room with an old man instead of finding an exit to the overworld. However, that is NOT a glitch - the exit to the overworld is hidden.  Instead of taking the stairs after exiting the teleportal, check along the southern wall for the exit.  I noticed some other reviewers were having the same problem I was, so I thought including this in the review would be helpful.
Tap location is below where I actually tap.
The touch is not aligned with the correct areas. Using mate 10 pro

Downloaded the update.  Still no fix.   Encountered the glitch where I am stuck in a room instead of being outside Rhone. I feel cheated after buying the game and wasting hours playing only to have a dead end I cannot work around. Was looking forward to continuing the series but I will not buy anything else from square after I see people having this issue months ago with no resolve.
It's kinda growing on me
Great remake of a classic. These games are perfect for playing in these platforms. Wish they would have kept the original NES names and text.
These were my childhood

Loved the game, ad I do all RPGs, I couldn't finish due to bugs!!! Couldn't wait to smash the boss due to my super level, but,bugs, helped me delete the awesome game, as I couldn't wait to buy the 3rd, after, 1st and 2nd, but y should I buy something that will screw me over, as did the free. Great game though. Never will I buy the last, because I couldn't finish the 2nd! Same as someone said, I went through the portal, and went up the stairs, and was in a small room with some guy, when I was supposed to be outside , so I could walk to use the false idle to get into ragnorock or what ever. Couldn't do it. Waste of time to play, can't finish!
Galaxy note 8 make sure you turn off full screen mode in game tools or you will have input issues.
Not sure what happened, but trying to walk in the over world is so sluggish it makes the game unplayable

It's great. Just the way I remember it as a kid. Except... It seems like you guys doubled the encounter rate. It's really really really annoying running into 3 monsters literally every 2 steps. Besides that, the game runs smoothly and looks great.
Great port. Expands a lot on the first

Second best game to Dragon warrior (quest) 4. Loved this game on the NES, still love this game on the android. I do wish theyd make more games like this again but with updated graphics, 3D even. Id go play all the dragon warrior/quest games again

Glitches make the game unplayable. I got stuck in a loop looking for the Prince. The priest at the well of heroes tells me he went to the castle but the king keeps telling me to go back to the well. He never tells me the Prince returned like he should. Checked the other town, no Prince. Searched the entire well,castle and town. No Prince. Please update or refund my money.

Great to play again, but just one issue. After using the warp to get to rendarak, the stairs lead to a building and there is no way to get out. Supposed to be able to go up the stairs and straight out to the world. Can't continue on the path with this bug.
Game locks up on title screen. Cannot press, "Venture Forth" or even "License". Very disappointing!!
Like All The Dragon Quest Games.

I quite enjoy the game but I have run into an issue on the Pixel XL 2. To activate a button or dialogue option, I need to touch about a quarter inch above where it located on screen.  This wasn't the case on my last phone (Nexus 6P) so it is probably related to the rounded corners on the screen that cause the game to shift down slightly so that it can display as a rectangle. Given that I haven't seen this in other apps, it seems like something Square-Enix has to fix.
Soon as I do any thing after I start the game it crashes. I loved the first one and I was very excited about this one. Please fix.
It's great but the game runs very slow
Touch controls are off on Pixel 2 xl.  You need to offset touch above the actual touch point
Great remake and amazing game.   Major issue is the placement of the "flee from battle" control; its ay to easy to accidentally run when you intend on fighting! Please redesign this!
Another faithful remaster. First class game of a first class classic!
Great
I love this franchise . Thank you squaresoft.
The game is just extremely slow without some kind of turbo feature. I tend to like old-school JRPGs but having random encounters every five or so tile is not fun.

This is where I recommend people start with the series, because it's the cheapest entry that offers a lot of content. Dragon Quest I was very bare-bones, but this game has much more to do and see, and is much better balanced than the original NES version. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a mobile JRPG.

I love the DQ (DW) series. I have them all on one system or another. BUT... I can't move 5 steps without getting attacked. I've had this for a week and didn't even get to level 10. Devs... let ME force myself to grind. Moving on to DQ3 heh heh.
A classic.
Great port.  I didn't like the NES version very much but this one is much more balanced and less grindy.  Highly recommend for DQ fans.
Ive got dq 1-6 and ff 1-6 all run great on my phone except this one which runs so slowly it unplayable. Really need an update but doubt there ever be one

Truly a Joy. The first games simplicity gives it a niche appeal these days but I felt this game really took strides. It's definitely old. Party members need to be resurected at towns after death and the only thing you get tracking your process are 5 symbols in your status screen. However if you can deal with having to remember the various cryptic hints random townspeople have to say in stay of a quest log this game will be a blast. It truly is a globe trotting journey that will have you searching every end of the earth to finish your quest. You will feel like an adventurer like never before.
indeed i enjoy playing this till the end......looking forward to play more of this one...!!!!!!!!!!!
Great
Great port, but hard as nails, and often obtuse. Not a good place to start the series, but a good test of skill for a longtime fan.
Almost perfect. Only thing I don't like is the lack of a Cloud backup service. üëç
Another great rendition of a classic RPG. The series gets better as it progresses.

I love what has been done to rework this series, but I changed phones and had to start over and I refuse to buy another squereenix game until cloud features are added. YOU SELL RPGs! These game are extremely long! Help us carry over data in some way!
Classic and still very playable.

No I didn't discard it accidentally, that requires a conformation and is not what happened.  I used it, my MP restored, and then I went to use it again and it's gone. As with Dragon Quest, this remake of the original brings a classic to the present with a fresh look and lots of nostalgic fun. Admittedly, some new players might be turned off by the necessary grind, but I commend Square Enix for keeping the game as it was.

If you sleep at the Inn in the town of Baran, you will lose the Prince of Cannock, who suddenly is deathly sick with the Curse of Hargon. To cure this, you must give him an Yggdrasil Leaf (walk up next to him an use the item on him as if he were in your party). To find an Yggdrasil Leaf, use a Chimaera Wing to warp to Zahan. Sail west and just a little bit north. You will see a small island with a single forest tile. Disembark on the island and search on the forest tile, and you will find the Yggdrasil Leaf
The changes made in this version make this the best version. The original NES game was not balanced well which made it frustrating. This one however is perfect. Really enjoyed it!

Fantastic port of a game I grew up with. Unlike the original Dragon Quest, the difficulty level has stayed mostly the same with this port. The extra features added that were also present in the revamped versions for the Game Boy and Super Famicom are a nice touch. Would have been nice to have battle animations, but you've never been able to expect too much from Square-Enix. It's such a shame how poor marketing and management in North America didn't allow this series to reach its full potential as it did in Japan.
Controls are responsive and smooth. No issues and it works really well on my Droid Razor HD phone. Now I just hope Dragon Quest 3 gets a similar update and a English release as well.
